name: ai_tech_stock_sentiment_2025
context: A financial psychology survey measuring investor attitudes toward the Artificial Intelligence sector in the year 2025. Following the initial boom of generative AI, the market has matured, leading to a bifurcation between established tech giants and speculative startups. This instrument assesses an investor's confidence in the long-term sustainability of AI valuations versus fears of an imminent market bubble burst, as well as their ethical comfort with investing in potentially disruptive technologies.

questions.preprompt: Considering the current valuation of major AI companies in 2025, how would {player_name} respond to the following:
questions.statement: {player_name} believes the current high stock prices for AI technology firms are justified by their future earnings potential.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on the rapid growth of the sector, does {player_name} agree or disagree with this assessment:
questions.statement: The AI market looks exactly like the 'dot-com' bubble of the early 2000s and is about to crash.

questions.preprompt: Looking at the long-term horizon for 2030 and beyond, evaluate this statement:
questions.statement: {player_name} is confident that AI will be the primary driver of global economic growth for the next decade.

questions.preprompt: When {player_name} looks at their portfolio performance during recent market swings:
questions.statement: {player_name} would feel comfortable holding onto an AI startup investment even if its value dropped 30% in a single month.

questions.preprompt: Considering {player_name}'s personal investment strategy regarding new tech:
questions.statement: {player_name} prefers stable, low-yield bonds over the unpredictable swings of the emerging AI sector.

questions.preprompt: Imagine a scenario where regulatory news causes a sharp market correction. How does {player_name} react:
questions.statement: {player_name} sees high daily volatility in AI stocks as an opportunity to buy the dip rather than a reason to sell.

questions.preprompt: Regarding the societal impact of the companies in {player_name}'s portfolio:
questions.statement: {player_name} would refuse to invest in an AI company that automates jobs without offering transition support for displaced workers.

questions.preprompt: When evaluating the financial returns of a potential investment:
questions.statement: Profit is the only metric that matters to {player_name}, regardless of whether the AI technology is used for surveillance or military applications.

questions.preprompt: Considering {player_name}'s moral compass in relation to financial decisions:
questions.statement: {player_name} actively seeks out AI funds that prioritize 'Responsible AI' governance and safety research.
